ğŸ¤”âœï¸ The activatiion Energy May be shown on diagram is called reaction profile or energy profile. The reaction profile of an exothermic reaction while the reaction profile of an endothermic reaction. The difference in energy between the reactants and the produk (the heat of reaction) is âˆ†H. For exothermic reaction, âˆ†H is negative; for endothermic reaction, âˆ†H is positive. The energy barrier, Ea , is the activatiion Energy for the foward reaction. Refer ğŸ“– Chemistry I for the activatiion Energy ğŸ˜…
ğŸ¤”âœï¸Applications of Le Chatelier's Principle in the Chemical Industri - The main problem encountered chemists is to establish the reaction condition for industries proses that will enable the reactants to be converted into produk in the most efficient and cheapest way. The three areas of concern in this respect are :- *Rate - how fast it is Produced. *Yield - how much of the produk is Produced. *Cost - how cheaply it can be Produced.        The first problem is clearly a kinetik Problem, that is to find the faster rate for the reaction. The second problems is a chemical equilibrium problem and involves the choice of conditions( temperature, pressure and presence of a catalyst) that favour a high yield of the produk in the equilibrium mixture.        Fritz Haber was a German chemists in 1908, he discovered that ammonia could be synthesised from nitrogen and hydrogen at relatively low temperatur using an iron catalyst . He received the Nobel Prize for Chemistry in 1918 .ğŸ˜…

Am fost aproape entuziasmata pana l-am auzit spunanad ca e unul dintre cei mai mari poluatori, pe persoana fizica si am realizat ca militantii notorii pt 0 co2 sunt niste indivizi care nu sunt dispusi sa renunte deloc la confortul lor. Oricum, ideea e excelenta, dar planul e foarte prost. Propun ca model de reusita socialismul luminat din Romania anilor 1970-1988, in care societatea, dar si individul recicla orice, consuma exact cat avea nevoie, nu risipea nimic si toti eram in primul rand linistiti. Apa, lumina, caldura erau rationalizate, iar individul producea in gospodarie cele de care avea nevoie in plus. Sau, si mai frumos, reintoarcerea la o viata simpla, rustica...cea dinaintea revolutiei industriale. Altfel, tot planul lor e o apa de ploaie, mai ales ca nici ei insisi nu fac nimic pentru a-si schimba obiceiurile.

Global warming is a natural occurrence. It will happen, no matter what we do. The historic data proves this. The same trends were happening hundreds of years ago... when there was no human industrialization. They will continue long after we are extinct. Vaccines, for Bill Gates, are a strategic philanthropy that fuels his many businesses in the field (including Microsoft's ambition to control a global campaign linking vaccination and identification) and gives him dictatorial control over global health policy. Global public health advocates around the world accuse Gates of hijacking the WHO agenda, moving it away from projects that have been proven to reduce infectious diseases: clean water, hygiene, nutrition and economic development. The Gates Foundation invests only 650 million of its $5 billion budget in these areas. Public health advocates say that Gates diverts WHO resources to serve his personal narrative that good health only comes in a syringe. In addition to using philanthropy to control WHO, UNICEF, GAVI (Vaccine Alliance) and PATH (an international global health organization), Gates funds a private pharmaceutical company that manufactures vaccines; and additionally donated $50 million to 12 pharmaceutical companies to accelerate the development of a vaccine for the new coronavirus.

What about massive reforestation within cities for shade, food, and to burn for dwelling heat using  smoke capture. Use a portion of the land turnover for green space on highly localized and  small parcels.  Burning wood is ok as long as the amount of co2 taken up by the plants during growth is slightly higher than that produced by combustion.  It all boils down to balancing rates from sources and sinks. If the rate of co2 capture by any mix of processes exceeds the production of co2 by any other mix of productive processes the trend in co2 will go down.

Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS)  Carbon dioxide, or CO2, is a normal product of metabolism within the bodyâ€™s cells. The blood carries this carbon dioxide waste to the lungs to be exhaled out of the system. When there is an elevated level of CO2 within the blood, complications occur. Doctors refer to this medical condition as hypercapnia, or hypercarbia. This can occur through health problems, environmental exposure to carbon dioxide or unsafe scuba diving practices or faulty diving equipment 1â­  â­  This is a verified and trusted source   U.S. Environmental Protection Agency: Acute Health Effects of Carbon Dioxide  Goto Source  .   Shortness of Breath  Too much carbon dioxide within the blood causes the bodyâ€™s pH level to plummet and become dangerously acidic, explains Auburn University at Montgomery School of Sciences. The higher the acidic quality, the more difficult it is for the bloodâ€™s hemoglobin to pick up oxygen. The result is rapid breathing in order to increase lowered oxygen levels and, eventually, difficulty in catching oneâ€™s breath.   Headache  The Advantages & Disadvantages of Carbon Dioxide  Learn More   A study revealed in a report by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) exposed 42 volunteers to inhalation of 7.6 and 10.4 percent of carbon dioxide within 2.5 to 10 minutes 1â­  â­  This is a verified and trusted source   U.S. Environmental Protection Agency: Acute Health Effects of Carbon Dioxide  Goto Source  . Headaches were a common adverse effect experienced by the study group individuals.   Increased Heart Rate  The human body reacts to carbon dioxide retention. As available oxygen lowers and carbon dioxide levels begin to rise, receptors within the body sense a problem and send messages to the heart to beat faster, according to Auburn University. This is an attempt to increase the amount of blood going to the lungs in hopes that CO2 is released and more oxygen inhaled.   Dizziness or Confusion.  What are the Effects of Smoking on the Cardiovascular System?  Learn More   In the same study results revealed by the EPA, the other most common side affect from excessive carbon dioxide exposure was dizziness. Those who inhaled high concentrations in only one minute had initial dizziness and then experienced bouts of confusion and inability to focus or reason.   Seizures  If 30 percent or more of carbon dioxide is inhaled, the body begins to convulse within 1.5 minutes, states the EPA. By this time, the body is unable to get rid of the carbon dioxide and obtain oxygen fast enough on its own. The bodyâ€™s receptors begin to lose control of body movement.   Unconsciousness or Coma  Humans exposed to high concentrations of carbon dioxide in a short time frame can experience catastrophic, lethal effects, according to the EPA. Instant exposure to 17 to 30 percent of CO2 after only one minute can result in unconsciousness and coma.  Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).  Respiratory Arrest  Medical conditions which cause weakening of the lungs can result in dangerously high levels of carbon dioxide. If the muscles are not strong enough to expand the lungs to sufficiently inhale, only a small amount of air and little to no carbon dioxide is exhaled. If untreated, this leads to lower and lower oxygen levels and eventually, cessation of breathing.   The Wrap Up  Carbon dioxide, or CO2, is a normal product of metabolism within the bodyâ€™s cells. Bob Dylan fooled the world for decades claiming to have written many of the melodies to his hit songs when in fact most of the melodies were from preexisting songs that he did not write, including Blowin In The Wind. In a last nail in the coffin scenario James Damiano's movie "Eleven Years" draws the straw that breaks the camel's back, rivets Bob Dylan to his secret past of plagiarism and rewrites musical history"......Virtue Films No artist can lay claim to the controversy that has surrounded the career of songwriter James Damiano. Forty Two years ago James Damiano began an odyssey that led him into a legal maelstrom with Bob Dylan that, to this day, fascinates the greatest of intellectual minds. Since auditioning for the legendary CBS Record producer John Hammond, Sr., who influenced the careers of music industry icons Charlie Christian, Billy Holiday, Bob Dylan, Pete Seger, Bruce Springsteen and Stevie Ray Vaughan , James has engaged in a half a billion dollar copyright infringement law suit with Bob Dylan. As the curtain rises on the stage of deceit we learn that CBS / Sony international recording artist, Bob Dylan not only used songs and lyrics written by James Damiano but also solicited Mr. Damiano's materials for a period of over ten years and eleven months. Nearly 40% of all global greenhouse gasses generate as a result of building related activities. Out of that, 28% as a result of building operation (mainly energy consumption for heating, cooling and lighting). Therefore building energy efficiency must be a top priority when it comes to green house gas reduction. Besides this transportation accounts for more than 23% emission. Public transportation and transport oriented cities are the keys to reduce transport related emission.  Unfortunately these are not highlighted in news reports, because they might not looks sexy for most people, I guess.

Meanwhile...from  poor countries perspective: India has two approved Covid vaccines, which includes Covishield (AstraZeneca) and Covaxin. The Government of India supplied both the vaccines to various lower Income countries across the globe. Vaccine Maitri (English: Vaccine Friendship) is a humanitarian initiative undertaken by the Indian government to provide made in India vaccines to other countries around the world. Indian government had started providing Indian made vaccines since January 20, 2021.India has supplied 70 lakh (7.0 Million) doses of free Covid-19 vaccines as part of an international grant while another 1 crore doses have been shipped or flown out of the country commercially and As of 15 March 2021, the Government of India supplied 58.64 million Made-in-India Covid vaccine doses to over 70 nations, of which, majority of them belong lower income countries.  Dr Peter Hotez, Dean of the National School of Tropical Medicine at Baylor College of Medicine in Houston, said "The rollout of the Covid-19 vaccine is "India's gift" to the world in combating coronavirus and will be remembered as a time when the country stepped up in a major way as a global player in innovation", he further added that, "The rollout of the Covid-19 vaccines by India in collaboration with leading global institutions has "rescued the world" from the deadly coronavirus and the contributions by the country must not be underestimated." Namaste and wish you and your family good luck and a healthy life  - from INDIA!

Depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.  For the LORD loveth judgment, and forsaketh not his saints; they are preserved for ever: but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.  The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.  The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom, and his tongue talketh of judgment. The LORD will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged. The idea that Carbon Dioxide is now somehow "Pollution" is unbelievable when we are actually "Breathing" it out and it is sustaining plants that produce Oxygen for us all to breathe.  That is tantamount to saying that we are "Polluting" the Air simply by "Breathing."  It is, however, a clever plot to reduce the entire world's Population and levy a monstrous Carbon Dioxide Tax on all nations to Tax the United Nations into its intended place as an actual World Government.
Atmospheric CO2 is a non-toxic, colorless, odorless trace that constitutes only a sparse, meager, minuscule, infinitesimal 0.038 percent of the Earth's atmosphere and is earth's Greatest Airborne Plant Fertilizer.  The CO2 Fertilization Effect actually states that the greater the amount of Carbon Dioxide, the faster the rate of Photosynthesis.  Newer, faster-growing plants consume more CO2 than older, slower-growing ones.

The Constitution, originally comprising seven articles, delineates the national frame of government. Its first three articles embody the doctrine of the separation of powers, whereby the federal government is divided into three branches: the legislative, consisting of the bicameral Congress; the executive, consisting of the president and subordinate officers; and the judicial, consisting of the Supreme Court and other federal courts. Article IV, Article V and Article VI embody concepts of federalism, describing the rights and responsibilities of state governments, the states in relationship to the federal government, and the shared process of constitutional amendment. Article VII establishes the procedure subsequently used by the thirteen States to ratify it. It is regarded as the oldest written and codified national constitution in force.

Nadire Yilmazer vor 1 Tag Dear Mr. Gates,   I am interested in newly developed (renewable energy generation) transmission technology for the energy transition in the soil. Water and air transport (also airspace / helicopters / military vehicles / drones, etc.). If you would like to know more, I will send a short information about the scientific background of the transmission development fundamentals.   The idea (problem): If you want to produce more power on the output side, you have to introduce more drive power into the gearbox accordingly. This is a problem with increasing the output on the side. It should actually be possible with lower drive power, multiple output-side power increases.   The solution: The problem is solved with the newly developed integral gear technology. You don't have to increase the drive power if you want to increase the output-side power. This creates a unique selling proposition on the market, as there is no applied technology of the same kind that transforms the inertia and resistance forces away. The driving forces are thus freed from load forces (functional prototype made / tried. It works!). The project and the   Areas of application: This gear technology is used wherever you want to increase the energy yield by approx. 7.8 times. For example, from wind turbines to (special) means of transport (electric drive technologies). The drive power of all means of locomotion and transport will work for years with small batteries. The diesel hold of container ships is being expanded and diesel drives are being abolished. The charging stations for electric cars will be superfluous. Rail traffic will run without a power grid. Funding for the renewable energy product will be increased by 100% until 2026. And these gaps can be closed more quickly after or with the integral gearbox. For the project we have to want the transmission, depending on the different performance classes, to achieve 100% zero Co2 emissions, we have to continue researching the transmission for the application and further developing it for the applications. The gearbox and its products must be marketed immediately.   Conclusion: The infrastructures, the world renewable energy generation technologies are being redesigned. And all the unprofitable contemporary technologies, productions and uses that are dependent on the German economy, the benefit of the environment with the newly developed integral gear technology will be restructured and they will disappear from the world market in a very short time! Integral gear technology will dominate the world energy market. The project is very, very, very big! It's a paradigm shift.   Therefore, I am looking for financial support (funding) from Breakthrough Energy or from Mr. Bill Gates. So that my new renewable energy generation technology must be implemented for the world and the energy industry. Thank you!  Email: I.Yoendem@gmx.de  Technology developer Ilyas Yondem

ğŸŒ Amy Klobuchar  According to astrology: May 25th The day of the Bold one.  Whatever their degree of sophistication, May 25 people are fighters.  They may be devoted to protecting a cause, and idea, their country or family.  Yet in no way are they archaic or conservative in their beliefs, remaining up-to-date in their attitude toward the world.  Those born on this day value money, clothes, all the outward trappings of life, yet understand that they are merely the facade of a deeper spiritual life within. Above all they recognize that freedom from tyranny, both for the individual and the group, is of the highest importance.  Since those born on this day are attuned to the rhythms of the world around them, they are able to survive social change, sometimes going with the flow, sometimes removing themselves. Their friends and family will find that they are charming and agreeable only to a point, however.  They will never compromise their opinions, even if it makes them unpopular.  May 25 people are philosophically oriented.  They have clear ideas on a wide variety of subjects, and these ideas are usually part of a larger, more universal code.  This may be a code of conduct their belief, or both.  Not only do those born on May 25 hold themselves to this standard, but may expect everyone else to follow it as well.  Those born on this day can be extremely unforgiving to those who cross the lines of decency. Honor and personal responsibility are immensely important to them, and their expectations are correspondingly high.  They must learn, however, to be more forgiving and tolerant in their treatment of Others.  May 25th people are not just mentally oriented, but markedly physical as well.  Unfortunately, their emotional side may be a bit repressed or, if damaged and childhood, severely blocked.  They value affection but find it both difficult to express and accept.  Since their self trust is not the highest, they may also be loath to trust others.  Whatever they do, be it art, sports, sex, or work, is beautifully crafted or executed, but unfortunately can also lack feeling.  Indeed, some born on this day take pride in themselves as cool personalities who are not given two displays of emotion.  What those born on May 25 must constantly fight is there fear of rejection.  Learning to be less fearful in general is important for them, no matter how forceful they may seem on the outside.  Building a foundation of self-confidence, perhaps slowly over the years, will guarantee them success in the world and keep them from sabotaging their own plans.  Those born on this day must find a way to live by their code of ethics without paralyzing themselves in introspection or self-criticism; their ideals should find expression in pragmatic ways.  Otherwise, May 25 people run the danger of becoming unrealistic about what they believe, and a bit out of touch with their true needs.  Other famous people born on this day: Miles Davis  Ralph Waldo Emerson Richard Dimbebly John K. Fairbanks Lindsey Nelson  Read from the book, "The Secret Language Of Birthdays", by Gary Goldschnieder and Joost Elffers.

Ok, first the manufacture of cement is done by heating marble chunks and driving off CO2 (horror), but as it is set, it re absorbs that same Co2 from the atmosphere.  (read here carbon neutral) Cows do not generate greenhouse gasses,  They eat vegetable matter and turn it into meat products, but, if grass is not eaten by livestock bacteria turn it into CO2 anyway in the field. The greatest carbon sink on earth is the limestone manufactured by diatoms that falls to the sea floor. This Co2 is what makes explosive volcanoes when it is submerges via plate tectonics. As described by social psychologists David Dunning and Justin Kruger, the bias results from an internal illusion in people of low ability and from an external misperception in people of high ability; that is, "the miscalibration of the incompetent stems from an error about the self, whereas the miscalibration of the highly competent stems from an error about others".[1] It is related to the cognitive bias of illusory superiority and comes from people's inability to recognize their lack of ability. Without the self-awareness of metacognition, people cannot objectively evaluate their level of competence.

Yes, Carbon dioxide is a greenhouse gas and we do need to reduce carbon dioxide emissions.  Methane gas and water vapour are also greenhouse gasses.  Many of industrial processes, transport vehicles of all kinds produce water vapour as well as carbon dioxide.   We need to be careful that new innovations do not add to the greenhouse gases problem. I am NOT saying this to stop innovation into new technologies, only to be mindful of other problems we may create. An example is using hydrogen fuel. When hydrogen gas is combined with oxygen to create energy for industry, water vapour is also a product. We need to find a way to capture that water vapour, and direct it to further good use.  Clean water for human consumption is also a problem in many regions.  Can we do this? I think innovative companies surely can.

The Wuhan virologists found that they could force an influenza virus to mutate and spread via aerosol droplets by injecting the virus from one ferret to another. By engineering the most lethal viruses in a laboratory setting, researchers believed they could better understand how to invent treatments and vaccines in the case of a real outbreak.  The Obama Administration put a halt on gain-of-function virology research in 2014, for fear of viruses leaking from the laboratory. This opened up an opportunity for Dr. Anthony Fauci to subcontract gain-of-function research on coronaviruses. Fauci concealed ongoing research through New Yorkâ€™s Eco Health Alliance. Dr. Fauci funded a project there to learn about the risk of new coronaviruses, and how they could emerge from wild animals to rapidly infect humans. A rise of CO2 content in the atmosphere of even 5 times what it is today (410 ppm.) would not make the world uninhabitable for mankind. It would need to get well above 2,000 ppm or so to even start causing problems for non-plant life. The pitiful 300 or 500 ppm predicted would not even come close the levels seen at the time of the dinosaurs during the Jurassic, Triassic and Cretaceous periods (a little over 2,000 ppm. ).   The worldâ€™s bread baskets (the areas that produce food) will most likely move more toward the poles. Possibly turning Northern Siberia and parts of Canada into the next big bread baskets instead of the frozen waste lands they are today.... So things will change, but it will take hundreds of years, more than enough time for populations to move and for food production and industry to adapt.  Again, this end of the world scenarios (desertification drought and famine) being promoted is nothing but propaganda used by globalists to push their agenda..... Why would a world with the climate like that found during the Jurassic, Triassic and Cretaceous periods be so bad? During this time the whole world became one gigantic green house producing not only ten times the food it does today but also the largest land animals and plants that have ever lived. And it did so for over a million years.  Case in pointâ€¦â€¦.Farmers who run greenhouses pump extra CO2 into their grow rooms to increase production. If it makes their plants produce more food what do you think will happen if all the plants of the entire world get the same treatment?   With more CO2 in the atmosphere plants grow better and produce more O2 and water vapor (AKA more rain ) and the % of N (nitrogen) in the air drops, the air gets thicker and we all (both plants and animals) breath better....  P.S. How do you verify that your mathematical model of future climate change and its affects are correct? You simply compare it to a time in the past when CO2 levels really did reach the predicted levelsâ€¦ And when did that happen? During the Jurassic, Triassic, and Cretaceous periods, a time of unparalleled plant and animal growth.  Then follow up with thisâ€¦.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j2vvgXFmVKw&t=1s

The degree to which atmospheric carbon dioxide inducing global warming strongly depends on how much water vapor (another greenhouse gas) the extra carbon dioxide adds to the atmosphere. I am not disputing the evidence of rising carbon dioxide, however, there are other important greenhouse gases that play a major role in increasing atmospheric temperatures. Such as Methane, CFC-11, HFC-132a, Nitrous Oxide, and carbon tetrafluoride. Respectably, they all have a half-life that is higher than carbon dioxide, relative to CO2, 12 years. For instance, Nitrous Oxide's half-life is 121.0 years, which means it traps more heat. Compared to carbon dioxide, methane packs 83 times the greenhouse warming punch over a 20-year period. Focusing on carbon dioxide may help, however, it's not the leading cause of global warming/climate change. The focus should be on decreasing the other greenhouse gases.
I planted a huge permaculture garden and now grow all my own food and for my neighbors on a 1/4 acre lot. The carbon emission from my food is negative, I planted over 60 trees, I prune them to stay small, they love carbon dioxide and suck it out of the atmosphere and turn it into clean oxygen, organic food and plant medicine. If I want meat, I can raise meat rabbits, who eat cover crop and turn it into fertilizer which helps the plants capture more carbon dioxide. Sure not everyone can or wants to do this, but many, many of us can. Why doesn't the government encourage this ğŸ¤”? There are solutions out there that don't require billionaire investors. There are solution that YOU can do. I felt so guilty feeling that I was contributing to the problem, but now I've taken steps to empower myself and make a real difference and it's more than just good for the environment, I've found it's been healing to my soul. Check out the documentary "Regreening the desert."

I am a vegan and would like to see a drastic reduction in meat consumption. The worst way to accomplish this goal is by selling Impossible burgers, which are gross, unhealthy (40+g of fat per), and made with cellulose, oil and various artificial fillers and flavor enhancers. They're so unpleasant they don't even list ingredients on their website.  Healthy vegan food is stuff like pasta, beans & rice, sweet potatoes, etc. that everyone loves. Why not just create a distribution chain to sell low-fat sweet potato burgers at Burger King? Companies like Dr. Praegers make great-tasting veggie patties that are healthy and use real food ingredients. It's not a technical challenge. You could use the type of investment put into Impossible & Beyond to make "meat" with potatoes, oats, etc. Better yet, just sell paper bowls of beans & rice that look like Wendy's chili. But nobody can dominate the supply chain and maintain a monopoly. The US dominates the world in meat exports. Gates represents an alignment of Chinese/Russian/Israeli/British interests, which would like to move feed production to places like India and Brazil, meat production to China, and vastly increase meat consumption in the developing world. Think of the sales opportunity of having a Burger King on every street corner in China and India. No more small farms - just "westernize" everything. They are trying to sink the US meat industry by suckering companies like Tyson into big investments in fake meat, lab-grown meat, cricket protein, etc. Every single lab-meat company is based in Israel. Impossible and Beyond are wholly PR creations. They get grocery shelf space not through sales performance (nobody eats this crap) but through "slotting fees" which are essentially bribes to retailers. Gates is utterly malevolent. Half the country realizes it, but my friends on the "left" need to look beneath the surface here and see what's going on.

I just see a billionaire trying to get people and governments to pay more for the same crap. He is onto something with changing everything to be sustainable though. But that has to be done whilst being more economical or a better product. Tesla Model S is the best example of a "greener" product being better at performance at the same time. The potential for vegetarian beef to taste exactly the same as normal beef AND be notably cheaper is another crucial sustainable milestone. Germany's hasty move towards fossil-free energy is an example where it's not, as they release more pollutants due to grid instabilities whilst paying more for electricity. The engineer has to think two steps ahead of the businessman and innovate a cheaper / better product that is at the same time more sustainable. This has to be done before the businessman chances upon the cheaper-only solution. They are, after all, far more driven by money. Bill Gates here is just a businessman waiting to capitalise on market disruptions, whether they truly benefit the world or not.

Bill is right that our focus on "low hanging fruit" will absolutely not provide the long term major advances needed.  Unfortunately, that is the direction we are following.  It is imperative we invest more on research and development as the yield potential can be expotential.  China understands this and is fully committed to becoming the absolute leader in technological development for the purpose of domination.  Their theft of technology, investment commitment and focus has provided them the ability to be in the leadership position.  While we have been the innovators, we have been foolish to allow the theft our our innovation to be used against us.  We must stop the theft and immediately move from our short term investment approach and focus on long term strategies.  Mr. Gates is absolutely correct "Without innovation, we will not solve climate change. We won't even come close."    It is depressing to see the ignorance in our society allowing them to be easily misdirected by false science and a complicit media.  Currently, the government is making huge missteps with energy policy to gain votes in the short term.  The important changes required can only be accomplished with a vibrant economy which is driven by energy.  Energy independence is crucial to allow us to fund development and transition to the new technologies while providing national security during this critical time.  Reaching an obtainable goal of clean energy and a healthy environment requires a balanced approach using fossil fuels to our advantage to produce meaningful, long term solutions.  We can no longer afford to make damaging decisions based on political bias and ideology.  Understand, the elimination of fossil fuels in the timeline being marketed in simply impossible.  Do your research.  Remember the "oil crisis" of the late 70's?  Long lines for gasoline, extreme shortages and predictions we would be out of fossil fuels in the very near future.  Don't be gullible.       Currently, there are several maturing technologies that will offer immense value to mankind and the world.  Unfortunately, you don't hear much about them as the media focus is on biased politics.  One you might wish to Check out is Graphene which is single layer of graphite and the 3rd most common element in our world.  Graphene will offer huge, unimaginable advances for our planet and every living creature.  Many times stronger and lighter than steel, can filter the worst water into pure drinkable water, almost zero resistance to current flow at room temperature and that is just the beginning.  Google it, study it, follow it and actively support science innovation.  There is reason for optimism but we must stop making ignorant political policies that will drastically affect our ability to significantly improve the quality of life for all.

Brilliant Light Powerâ€™s Suncell modules presently produce 100kW to 350kW of thermal energy, but versions to 900kW thermal energy per cell are under development. These modules would require about 10% of the output power level as input electrical power in expected commercial models. The high temperature output can be converted to electrical power using micro turbogenerators (typically with about 30% conversion efficiency)

Liquid sodium is VERY combustible!  In fact, my chemistry professor told us a story of an old glass container he threw into a small water pond behind him at some point, not knowing what specifically was in the container, & found out rather violently that it was sodium--the water molecules DRASTICALLY bond with pure sodium, when that happens--which is why most salts have a sodium element within them--it's a natural bonder to make a salt.  It's also why you don't ever see Sodium in its solitary elemental form, like you would with gold, etc.  So how that WOULD be handled during a nuclear meltdown is a question I would need a proper answer to--as well as how you would remove the now super-violent radioactive waste it'd eventually create.

In 50 years, there's going to be like 11 billion people on the planet and more further down the line. Is any ecological technology really going to make that big of a difference? I mean this world's environment is not limitless and on a long enough timeline, Earth's resources just won't suffice.   Another thing and perhaps even more important - all these big, lavish ideas about saving the world are made by westerners living in the western world. Western world to a degree is living off of imbalance - in other words, for us to live comfortably and have our PCs, mobile phones, and so on at affordable prices, poor people elsewhere need to be exploited. Gates himself wouldn't be as rich as he is if he didn't manufacture cheaply in some poor countries, where ecology probably isn't the first problem they deal with. And of course, he wasn't ethical and moral enough to give up his comfort to help the world, he's helping only now when he's amassed an insane fortune. So my question is - how do you get the majority of the world, which is poor and technologically stagnant, to go along with this huge plan to save the world? When these people barely have resources to live a decent life? Is Gates and co. going to help these countries for free or give up his luxuries? I doubt it. And that goes for everyone in the western world.   So a lot of this is rich westerners coming up with ideas that are sound technically and philosophically, but that probably won't be implemented so easily in the real world. I personally think it's impossible for real change to occur without: a) a huge conflict where people will desperately fight for resources, or b) some huge natural catastrophe which literally forces us to change.

I question the current technology regarding catalytic converters. The common term "carbon footprint" I believe, is very misleading. Carbon is great - it turns into sugar...a building block of life. Carbon dioxide...that's the evil doer. The catalytic converters are great where smog is an issue. However, they are afterburners that provide no motive power or charging of batteries in hybrid vehicles. These converters should run in bypass mode where smog is not a problem. This change could result in a very real element in our quest to reduce carbon dioxide in the atmosphere.

There are 7 greenhouse gases: Water Vapour, Methane, Nitrous Oxide, Ozone, Carbon Dioxide, Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and Hydrofluorocarbons. Bill says he wants to get rid of all of them - there is a problem with this. Water Vapour (aka - clouds) is essential for rain and is also the most prevalent of all the Greenhouse gases. In-other-words, clouds have more effect on how much heat gets in from the sun and how much heat gets out from human activities than all of the other greenhouse gases combined. I haven't investigated Gate's claim about injecting carbon dioxide into cement, but he is doing the hard stuff.  The problem with cement is that the basic ingredient is CaCO3 (calcium carbonate) of which carbon dioxide is released.  Is the carbon dioxide of the process reinjected into the cement?  Underwater current electrical generation is the backbone that nuclear generation provides.  I would like to see Gates put more emphasis in this area.  As far as electrical storage goes...which all electric cars have, the car battery can function as a battery for the grid.  When cars are used as a two way process, energy stored in car batteries can shipped to other areas as well as receiving energy to drive the car.  Car batteries will smooth out the grid just as natural gas peaking plants and hydroelectric storage plants already do.  For instance, Germany on many days has excess solar electricity capacity, and Denmark excess wind energy, that are now being stored as water in reservoirs in Norway.  Excess energy as used to pump water into an empty reservoir on excess energy days and then water is released to make hydroelectric energy when the grid needs more energy than can be provided for no sunlight (or cloudy days) and no wind.
I will invest in the companies Gates is investing in; I'd like to have a portfolio in which sustainable/environmentally-conscious companies make up 50% of it.  As for the plant-based meat, yogurt, etc.: I think the "meat" will be nutritionally balanced when a female athlete (especially a runner or another athlete whose sport has a high degree of shock-impact) who is anaemic, can perform optimally, without performance lows due to iron-deficiency or the anaemia caused by it.  Non-haem sources, as I've personally found out, aren't nearly enough if you want to run well and sustain upwards of 60 mpw. The yogurt, hopefully will have enough calcium, vitamin D, etc. to keep bones healthy.   I get that this is all to help the planet - which is great and I'm all for it, but I'm not willing to risk my health & performance goals as an athlete either. There are most definitely things I CAN and WILL do and there are things that I simply cannot.

This is the Green Revolution, such as the industrial revolution, but rather a focus on the replacing of current methods of production and energy generation with methods that fit a environmentally sustainable pattern.  Key difference:  The past revolutions impetuses were economic gain and subsequently caused inadvertent social change, where economic gain can be defined as acquiring resources such as the increased efficiency and harvesting capability of farm land in the agricultural Revolution, production output in the industrial Revolution, and the digital Revolution which has disrupted most business today.   What changes in the Green Revolution?: Products produced by new methods or materials. Energy generated through means to fullest extent possible by renewable sources.        Key breakthroughs required:  Material science, energy storage, offsetting agricultural and livestock emissions, carbon capture, accelerating developing countries past the need to follow our current methods of energy generation and manufacturing,   Notable problems of Green Revolution: Market driven decisions on all past revolutions were the main driver of creating more crops per acre, products per hour, or algorithm to replace data-entry tasks. Green Revolution does not start from the premise of economics rather from the dangers of continuing our current methods. There may be certain industries in which the cost of the green product or manufacturing method will not compete with the emissions method therefore the market will not be able to correct. More government intervention will then be required.       Key takeaway from problems of Green Revolution: Green product may not be able to compete and thus more government intervention will be required. Need Global cooperation.   Social change key difference per Revolution:      Agricultural: The ability to build cities and gather large groups of people, collect the best minds and set up systems to foster growth only achievable through large scale cooperation.      Industrial:  Build the necessary products and materials requested for cities and to accommodate a growing population of people.      Digital: Long-distance communication system to interconnect globe, decentralize and promote free exchange of ideas.      Artificial intelligence(still is not as developed): The natural extension of automating tasks for increased efficiency and efficacy and providing individuals with lower cost products and services.

What we need now is technical perspiration and political inspiration.   5.) Mr. Musk has been compared to Edison, who said that : â€œGenius is 1 percent inspiration and 99 percent perspirationâ€. He would probably agree to that.  6.) In reality, when compared to the U.S. GDP the perspiration required is relatively small, on the order of two (2) percent of GDP per year (about 400 billion $US), for about 10 to 15 years.  7.) The low hanging fruit are Photovoltaics and Insulation/Energy efficiency, but those would disturb quite a bit the fossil fuel providers who still wield a lot of financial power.  8.) What we need is to invest $200 billion a year in the infrastructure for making solar grade silicon for solar cells and aluminum for solar panel supporting structures.  9.) Solar panels today can be bought at $0.20/W, so in volumes of 500 GW per year, the cost for the solar panels should be less than 100 billion $US. 10.) When the U.S. installs 500 GW per year for 10 years, it will have all the electricity that it regularly consumes in a year, supplied by solar power alone. It can be done. Definitely not rocket science. 11.) The U.S. petroleum industry has brought a lot of wealth to our Nation for more than 150 years. It would be prudent to "help them" make the transfer from "old energy" to "new energy". 12.) Provide subsidies to land owners whose land produces fossil fuels and install plenty of solar power in those lands, along with high voltage distribution lines, as needed.  13.) Provide subsidies to companies engaged in the extraction of fossil fuels from deposits in the earth, when they support the development of full self-sufficient solar power.  14.) Provide incentives to the labor that now earns a living extracting, processing and delivering all sorts of fossil fuels so that they help build out solar power, truly the lowest cost energy form. 15.) All other remaining issues (energy or otherwise) will be addressed by the expenditures made with the 98% of yearly GDP that is not solar energy development.  16.) Investing two (2) percent of GDP per year, into serious solar development is really the smart way to really ensure our Nation's future and not too much to ask, really.

*Bill Gate is a victim of group-think mind control.*  We now have record snow, ice, and cold in Texas and New Jersey, and the Thames River in England has frozen solid for the first time in 60 years.  Insanely, people are worried the world is burning up due to a tiny trace gas that makes up just .04% if our atmosphere. The IPCC has become *The Ministry of Fear.*  If they do not continuously produce hallucinatory computer projections predicting global doom they don't get paid.  It's a fear factory, not science.   The embarrassing truth is there is no greenhouse gas effect because no free flowing gas can trap heat.  The greenhouse gas theory was concocted in the 1850s, but never proven.  The latest space probe, satellite, and weather balloon data all tell us that nothing unusual is happening to our climate and that there is no greenhouse effect going on.  The IPCC models do not account for *through mass energy transmission,* which is the process that makes a Newton's Cradle toy work.  Combine that with convection cooling and you have a situation where heat trapping becomes impossible.  You need a solid glass or plastic wall to produce a greenhouse effect.  The modest infrared absorbing properties of carbon dioxide and methane only make convection cooling work more effectively, so the net result is nothing.   Search YouTube for my name and look at the climate and weather related videos on my YouTube home page.  You can also search for *Balloons in the Air: Understanding Weather and Climate*  The Church of Climate Change is rotten to the core.  We all need sex and carbon to survive and reproduce the species.  Your own children are 18.5% carbon by weight because all of our food is made from carbon.  Everything we do to fight carbon will increase the cost of food.  *Do you yearn for food cost hyperinflation?*  Making people feel guilty for being sex sinners or carbon sinners is the work of religious charlatans, not clear minded scientists.  Carbon dioxide is the gas that creates and fuels all life on Earth, not a pollutant.  Plants eat carbon dioxide and we eat plants.  More CO2 just means more food and lumber for us.  That is why some greenhouses pump in CO2 to make plants grow faster and bigger.

I think if we focus on getting emissions down to zero we'll never solve climate change. We need to reduce emissions as much as reasonably possible and find ways to sequester or offset whatever can't quickly be switched to a zero emission alternative. We could probably use algae to remove co2 from the atmosphere and use the algae itself as a product. 45 billion tons of algae would completely offset today's emission levels, so if we assume we can get a 2/3 reduction in total emissions and use 15 billion tons of algae per year we'd stop the advancement of human caused climate change.  We could use 15 billion tons of algae for a lot of things, like as a fertilizer, a source for bio-fuel, a replacement for petroleum in the production of plastics, even as feed stock for animals and protein bases for humans.

"Every aspect of our daily lives must change." in other words get more expensive. Is it worth it?   Yes, staying alive is worth it.   At this point I consider climate change about 90% likely. Human caused climate change? Perhaps 50% likely. (In other words, I'm a climate change sceptic.) But human caused or not, too much climate change will collapse the environment leading to lots of killing effects such as a drop in oxygen levels. The odds of this much climate change I put at about 70%.  Now if a doctor told me I had cancer and it had a 70% chance of killing me and another 20% chance of crippling me, I would be concerned. If he offered me an expensive chemo treatment that reduced the risk of dying to 10%, I would take it. So yes, fighting climate change is worth the effort even if it is expensive and hard to do.   But can it be done? No. We are in a tragedy of the commons situation. If we all change, the little extra work is easily accomplished. But it is to each individual's benefit to not change. While a country might pass laws enforcing these changes, it is also to each country's benefit to cheat. Further, in many (most?) countries either rule of law is weak, or corruption endemic enough to undermine the country's good faith efforts.   Of course not all (or even most) countries' efforts will be in good faith. Of the 195 countries that signed the Paris accords (which are not nearly strong enough) only 7 are compliant, and those were all given "developing world" status, which means their targets were lower than the developed world. (For example, China, the world's second largest economy, is still allowed to increase its pollution levels under the accords. China is not one of the 7 who made even this low bar.) Nearly every nation lied about what it was going to do.    In order to survive, we need massive technical innovations like Mr. Gates claims. But we also need a fundamental shift in how we govern ourselves. This shift needs to occur in the non-Western countries. I don't see that happening.   But if it is to happen, I don't think we can rely on Bill Gates. He may be rich, but he's only one man.   We need philosophers who believe in humanity (I'm not sure there are any) to come up with new forms of governance. We need strong, honest young men and women willing to act as police and soldiers to enforce that new governance without corruption. We need truth tellers to motivate people to avoid corruption. (It used to be journalists did this. Now, they are the corrupt.) We need entertainers who tell stories that motivate all these other people. And finally, all of this needs to happen primarily in non-Western countries where polluters like to move to when environmental regulations become a burden to the bottom line.    Technological innovation is hard, but it's far easier than social innovation. I hope this climate change thing is a hoax like the conspiracy theorists claim, because otherwise we are dead.

No amount of soy burgers, electric cars, carbon-injected concrete can overcome the stress that too many people places upon earth's fragile ecosystem. New and relatively untested products pose their own potential dangers to human health and that of the planet. Industry may develop a more effective coolant for the cores of nuclear reactors, but how will that overcome the greed of corporate manufacturers who want to cut corners to fabricate those reactors or the buildings that house them? There is the insurmountable problem of human nature, which technological innovation cannot fix. Nature has tools for checking unsustainable population growth, such as pandemics, but they are cruel, blunt, and relentless. We can either evolve wiser and enlightened or let the planet put us back in our place. I am not saying Gates is wrong to explore and invest in anything that will help, but the lifestyle change that will help the most is to create fewer (and better) people. Without that, sheer numbers seal our fate. Gates has already said elsewhere that he is sure the world of the future will not require nearly so many people working to run it. If beef were kept on grass, rather than in CAFOs (concentrated animal feeding operations) there would not be huge pools of effluent emitting carbon into the atmosphere.  That change in how cattle are raised would also improve the health of the cattle while living and the meat we consume after the cow is butchered.  In CAFOs cattle are fed grain.  Beef anatomy has evolved to convert grass (carbon  based plants) into meat and milk p, both high protein foods.  Cattle do not need grain to thrive.  Large cattle companies know, however, that cows who eat grain get fat quickly.  So their bottom line is enhanced by fattening the cows.  They end up with more pounds of beef to sell.  But concentrating many cows into small spaces during the 30-90 day fattening period causes huge build up of cattle excrement that must be dealt with, usually with lined ponds that release tons of methane into the air as it decomposes.  By raising cattle on grass in the proper ratio of cattle per square foot of available grass, our bovine friends can be healthier and have a better quality of life. I would hate to see the planet dispense with cattle, which are really marvels of biology and evolution and important providers of protein and milk.

Interesting choice for a 'new' design of nuclear reactors. A sodium-cooled reactor, the only one of its kind, was used to power the U.S. Navy's second nuclear-powered submarine USS Seawolf (SSN 575) back in 1957. "Expensive to build, complex to operate, susceptible to prolonged shutdown as a result of even minor malfunctions, and difficult and time-consuming to repair," as explained by Admiral Rickover. In other words, a failed experiment and, as a result, the U.S. Navy's Nuclear Submarine Force went with water cooled reactors and the rest is history to this present day. Best of luck Bill with a fully automated sodium-cooled reactor - I sure hope you have ex-Navy Sub Force Nuclear Techs and Engineers on your project.

Then the likes of AOC and her wisdom said the same thing. Now, Gates is saying 30 years. ... The causations for what is considered global warming, or climate change keeps changing. From what I can tell, no "expert" on the subject has ever tried to explain the high temps over 100 years ago. Other than the industrial revolution. Even if that were the case, you still have to explain how it took 100 years to move past such record temps all the while the global population began to explode and more and more forests were cut down. During the American Civil War it was considered that the earth was going through a mini ice age. In the early 1900s the temps were so high in the North East that in New England the iron railroad rails began to melt and buckle. Was the climate more hostile towards human beings then as too now? My guess is that like my whole 43 years on this rock, when we get 30 years down the road the reasons and causations for the global condition will be something all together different with the same amount of alarmism. I'm all for private industry to innovate and makes things more efficient. But we need to admit that humans don't control weather or climate. Only God.

He pointed out the main flaw in combating climate change when he admits to having such a large carbon footprint. Humans are too stubborn to change their lifestyle and comforts in an effort to make significant change. This guy throws money into the idea of a 'carbon offset' but it doesn't change the fact that his company uses up resources which causes the same emissions he's trying to rally against. Everyday people can't 'offset' their carbon footprint in the way he apparently does. Talking about technical innovations is one thing, but there needs to be more focus on the human psyche and how to culturally move away from the idea of extravagant lifestyles.
